summary: Manifest linking, manifest contents, service worker registration, and a minimal service worker with fetch handling/navigation fallback appear to be implemented. However, the diff also includes substantial unrelated UI/feature and styling changes, and there is no concrete diff evidence of addressing REQ-5 installability verification criteria beyond adding PWA files.

missing_requirements.requirement: Verify and fix any remaining installability criteria issues (secure context, start URL reachable, no manifest/SW console errors blocking install prompt across major browsers).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows adding/updating manifest, index.html link/registration, and sw.js, but does not provide evidence of addressing broader installability criteria checks (e.g., ensuring secure context in deployment, confirming start_url reachability in routing, or eliminating console errors across browsers). Those are primarily verification/outcome-based and not demonstrable from the provided changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Multiple unrelated application UI/feature changes (intro overlay behavior, data prefetch, header/footer changes, upload UI changes including speech-to-text dictation, gallery/note viewers, dialogs, etc.).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly constrained changes to PWA installability only and disallowed other functionality/visual changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Global styling and layout changes (OKLCH theme system, mobile-only viewport constraints, new animations).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; violates the constraint of no visual appearance changes beyond PWA metadata/installability.

hallucinated_features.description: Branding/copy changes in HTML/manifest metadata (new meta description, title text, app description).
hallucinated_features.reason: Non-goals/constraints disallow changing user-facing copy/branding unrelated to PWA metadata; these changes go beyond the minimum required installability fields.
